St. Francis Xavier University Admission Requirements, International Baccalaureate, English Language Proficiency Requirements, Steps to apply.

St. Francis Xavier University Admission is ongoing for all interested candidates who wish to apply; the admission is open for all nationals

St. Francis Xavier University Admission Requirements

International Baccalaureate:

  • Students who complete the International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma with a minimum score of 24 will be considered for admission
  • Minimum grade requirement for any subject is 3
  • Students can submit predicted or anticipated results for early fall admission and scholarship purposes

Transfer Credit

  • Students admitted to StFX with a grade score of 30 or higher on the IB Diploma, and who have received a score of at least 5 on all higher level and standard level courses, will be granted up to 30 credits.
  • Students who have any one least amount score falling below 5 will have their courses together assessed for possible transfer credits.
  • Students who have completed IB courses but who do not possess the diploma, or who scored less than 30 on the IB Diploma, may receive individual university course credit if they have achieved grades of 5, 6, or 7 in higher level courses.

English Language Requirements for International Students

Recognized English language proficiency tests:

Test maximum score
IELTS 6.5 in general and no lower than 6.0 in each band
TOEFL 90 iBT and no lesser than 20 in each band
MELAB 81
CAEL 70 in general and no lower than grade score of 60 in each band
C1 Advanced 180 overall and no lower than 170 in each band
C2 Proficiency 180 in particular and no lower than 170 in each band

Some Students might not be necessary to provide confirmation of English language proficiency if they have accomplished the following:

  • If you have studied the last 2 years in a high school or university where the average of tutoring is English.  A Proof of English as the language of instruction must be included in the application, either through a letter from the school or on the transcript.
  •  If you are a student with the Maya Scotia International Students Program (NSISP), studying at a Maya Scotian high school, and you have effectively achieved a maximum average of  70% in Grade 12 English, or corresponding
  • You have successfully accomplished the International Baccalaureate Diploma with English Language (A)

Admission Requirements for Canadian applicants

For high school students, the minimum requirements include an overall average of 70% in Grade 12, with no marks below 65% in each of the required subjects.  Admissions to limited enrollment programs are competitive, thus, minimum grade requirements are subject to change.
